title.value: Functional Status Assessment for Total Hip Replacement

text.value: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older with primary total hip arthroplasty (THA) who completed baseline and follow-up patient-reported functional status assessments

value.value:
Limited proprietary coding is contained in the Measure specifications for user convenience. Users of proprietary code sets should obtain all necessary licenses from the owners of the code sets. THE MEASURES AND SPECIFICATIONS ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND.
Due to technical limitations, registered trademarks are indicated by (R) or [R] and unregistered trademarks are indicated by (TM) or [TM].

Measuring functional status for patients undergoing total hip replacement permits longitudinal assessment - from the patient's perspective - of the impact of surgical intervention on pain, physical function, as well as health-related quality of life (Rothrock 2010)

The American Association of Hip and Knee Surgeons (AAHKS) states that it is important to ensure that the general/mental health survey be completed prior to surgery during the preoperative visit, as well as the post-operative visit. AAHKS recommends using a general health instrument, such as the VR-12 or PROMIS Global 10 in addition to condition-specific tools.
A higher score indicates better quality

The American Association of Hip and Knee Surgeons (2015). Patient Reported Outcomes Summit for Total Joint Arthroplasty Report. Retrieved from the American Association of Hip and Knee Surgeons Website: http://www.aahks.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/pro-summit-report-2015.pdf

Rothrock NE, Hays RD, Spritzer K, Yount SE, Riley W, Cella D. Relative to the general US population, chronic diseases are associated with poorer health-related quality of life as measured by the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS). J Clin Epidemiol 2010; 63(11):1195-204.

A Functional Status Assessment (FSA) is based on administration of a validated instrument to eligible patients that asks patients to answer questions related to various domains including: pain, physical function, emotional well-being, health-related quality of life, symptom acuity

Patients 18 years of age and older who had a primary total hip arthroplasty (THA) within the 12 month period that begins 180 days before the start of the measurement period and ends 185 days after the start of the measurement period and who had an outpatient encounter not more than 180 days prior to procedure, and at least 60 days and not more than 180 days after THA procedure
Patients with multiple fractures indicating trauma at the time of the total hip arthroplasty or patients with severe cognitive impairment

Patients with patient-reported functional status assessment results (eg, VR-12, VR-36,PROMIS-10-Global Health, PROMIS-29, HOOS) not more than 180 days prior to the primary THA procedure, and at least 60 days and not more than 180 days after THA procedure
For every patient evaluated by this measure also identify payer, race, ethnicity, and sex

list.item:
Union of:
"Encounter, Performed: Outpatient Consultation"
"Encounter, Performed: Face-to-Face Interaction"
"Encounter, Performed: Office Visit"
"Encounter, Performed: Postoperative Visit"

"Procedure, Performed: Primary THA Procedure" satisfies any:
<= 180 day(s) ends before start of "Measurement Period"
<= 185 day(s) ends after start of "Measurement Period"
ends concurrent with start of "Measurement Period"
"Diagnosis: Fracture - Lower Body" using "Fracture - Lower Body Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.113.12.1037)"
"Diagnosis: Severe Dementia" using "Severe Dementia Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.526.3.1025)"
"Encounter, Performed: Face-to-Face Interaction" using "Face-to-Face Interaction Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.101.12.1048)"
"Encounter, Performed: Office Visit" using "Office Visit Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.101.12.1001)"
"Encounter, Performed: Outpatient Consultation" using "Outpatient Consultation Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.101.12.1008)"
"Encounter, Performed: Postoperative Visit" using "Postoperative Visit Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.101.12.1070)"
"Functional Status, Performed: Functional Status Assessment for Hip Replacement" using "Functional Status Assessment for Hip Replacement Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.118.12.1029)"
"Procedure, Performed: Primary THA Procedure" using "Primary THA Procedure Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.1003.198.12.1006)"
"Patient Characteristic Ethnicity: Ethnicity" using "Ethnicity CDCREC Value Set (2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.837)"
"Patient Characteristic Payer: Payer" using "Payer SOP Value Set (2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.3591)"
"Patient Characteristic Race: Race" using "Race CDCREC Value Set (2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.836)"
"Patient Characteristic Sex: ONC Administrative Sex" using "ONC Administrative Sex AdministrativeGender Value Set (2.16.840.1.113762.1.4.1)"
None

list.item: AND: Age>= 18 year(s) at: "Measurement Period"
AND: Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
AND: $OptConsultorOVorF2FEncounter <= 180 day(s) ends before start of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure

AND: Intersection of:
$OptConsultorOVorF2FEncounter >= 60 day(s) ends after end of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
$OptConsultorOVorF2FEncounter <= 180 day(s) ends after end of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
AND: Initial Population

OR: Count>= 2 :
"Diagnosis: Fracture - Lower Body" satisfies all:
< 1 day(s) starts before start of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
overlaps Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
OR: "Diagnosis: Severe Dementia" overlaps "Measurement Period"
AND: "Functional Status, Performed: Functional Status Assessment for Hip Replacement (result)" <= 180 day(s) ends before start of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure

AND: "Functional Status, Performed: Functional Status Assessment for Hip Replacement" satisfies all:
(result)
>= 60 day(s) ends after end of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
<= 180 day(s) ends after end of Occurrence A of $PrimaryTHAProcedure
